subject: Web3
title: The Silk Road Trial
description: One-minute skill: The Silk Road Trial.

hook.text: In 2013, the FBI shut down Silk Road, an online black market that used Bitcoin. Its founder Ross Ulbricht was arrested.

buildup.text: Silk Road processed over $1 billion in Bitcoin transactions. It proved crypto could power an underground economy.

discovery.text: Ulbricht was convicted on seven charges including money laundering and conspiracy. He received two life sentences.

twist.text: Two federal agents investigating Silk Road were themselves convicted of stealing Bitcoin during the investigation.

climax.text: Silk Road shaped public perception of Bitcoin as criminal money. The stigma took years for the industry to overcome.

punchline.text: The trial that linked Bitcoin to crime. The stigma lasted longer than the marketplace.

quiz.question: What happened to two federal agents investigating Silk Road?
options: They were convicted of stealing Bitcoin during the investigation
